title: Creating a Diagram
text: There are a few ways to approach this problem. We need to divide the expression for the volume of the solid by the expressions for the length and width. Let us create a sketch.\n##figure1.gif##

title: Creating an Equation
text: We can now write an equation by substituting the known values into the formula for the volume of a rectangular solid. $$V=l w h$$. $$3x^4-3x^3-33x^2+54x=3x \left(x-2\right) h$$\n

title: Solving for H
text: To solve for $$h$$, we can first divide both sides by $$3x$$. We now have $$(x-2)h=x^3-x^2-11x+18$$

title: Synthetic Division
text: We now solve for $$h$$ by using synthetic division as shown.\n##figure2.gif##
